name: 'In God We Trust' Online Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 6 | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Reverend.

	On the TV screen, Don Butler's name was listed with a Reverend in front of it. Reverend Butler also told Vinick on national television that he was welcome at his church any time. Reverend Butler conceded to Vinick making Vinick the Republican candidate for President.

questions.text: Sheila said that Ray Sullivan was the best bet for Republican Vice President.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Sheila said that Don Butler was the best bet for Republican Vice President, but Ray Sullivan was the best man for the job. In the end, Vinick chose Ray Sullivan as his Vice President because Don Butler told Vinick he didn't like his views on abortion.

questions.text: Who didn't like Santos in a photo op with the President and Vice President?
questions.explanation:
Will.

	Will thought it was a bad idea to have a photo op with both Santos and the Vice President and then when CJ told him it was going to happen, Will asked that the Vice President have a separate photo taken with the President. CJ declined the idea.

questions.text: Did the President say he liked the New Testament?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Vinick and the President were discussing religion and the last time Vinick read the Bible. Vinick said he couldn't understand all the laws in the Old Testament and President Bartlet said he was more of a New Testament reader.

questions.text: "We've got nobody who can beat him." Who was Leo talking about?
questions.explanation:
Vinick.

	Leo and the President were watching Arnold Vinick accept the Republican nomination for President.

questions.text: After coming up with a good plan for minimum wage, what did Vinick and the President do to bide the time?
options: Read some of President Bartlet's old books
President Bartlet told him about all the national parks
questions.explanation:
Ate ice cream.

	Vinick wanted it to look like they had taken longer to come up with a plan for minimum wage, so the President took him downstairs for ice cream. While downstairs, the President and Vinick talked about religion.

Santos.

	Toby fell asleep watching for the results. Later, Annabeth told them that Santos won.

questions.text: What was the name of the daughter Sheila was taking to a baseball game?
questions.explanation:
Tina.

	Tina was the only one of Sheila's children to be seen on the show. Vinick wanted Tina to catch a foul ball for him, but she said if she caught a foul ball she was keeping it for herself.

questions.text: Of what state was Ray Sullivan governor?
questions.explanation:
West Virginia.

	Sheila read Sullivan's file to Vinick. Not only was he the Governor of West Virginia, but he was also a prosecutor with a 98% conviction rate on white collar crime.

questions.text: "If you have a question on religion, please go to church." To whom did Vinick make this comment?
questions.explanation:
Press.

	The President offered to go on television and say that a candidate shouldn't be looked at just because of his religion, but Vinick didn't want him to do that. When Vinick made that statement, he was outside the White House talking to the press and the President was inside watching him on television.
